title: Ticket #4883: Python bindings for dprintf
description:
Use Case

See #4875 - use case duplicated below:

The OSG is starting a new project to investigate management of Xrootd caches placed in strategic (in terms of networking) locations around the grid.

One important aspect of this is to improve the management of the remote instances. We'd like the xrootd daemons to run underneath the HTCondor master.

Thus, we would like to have a python script which sits between the master and the xrootd daemon that periodically advertises to the collector and sends heartbeats to the master.

As a part of this, we'd like the python shim script to be able to act as a DC-like daemon. Particularly, we'd like to be able to control the logging via the normal HTCondor logging subsystem

Proposal

I propose we add a "log" method to the HTCondor module with the following 

log(level, msg)
Log a message to the HTCondor logging subsystem.
   :param level: Log category and formatting indicator; use the LogLevel enum for a list of these (may be OR'd together).
   :param msg: String message to log.

Unlike "dprintf" proper,

  1. This will automatically add "\n" to the end of the log string.
  2. This doesn't accept formatting characters; python lets you do this directly.
